arm_group.description: Heliox is use in this group
Oxygen is used in this group

brief_summary.textblock:
Heliox can lower respiratory resistance, improve the oxygenation, reduce respiratory
      distress and lung injury caused by mechanical ventilation.

clinical_study.brief_title: Heliox in Preterm Infants With Respiratory Distress Syndrome

detailed_description.textblock:
Heliox can improve the oxygenation, reduce respiratory distress and lung injury caused by
      mechanical ventilation.

      Heliox has not been widely used. More studies on the effects and safety of Heliox in
      addition to NIPPV and mechanical ventilation should be tried.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Gestational age more than 28 weeks and less than 32 weeks

          -  Diagnosed as respiratory distress syndrome

          -  Need to use NIPPV ventilation

          -  No congenital diseases or hereditary diseases

          -  With an informed consent form

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  With congenital diseases or hereditary diseases

          -  Intubated in the delivery room

          -  Need surgery

intervention.description: heliox or oxygen is used in the two groups respectively

facility.name: Daping Hospital and Research Institute of Surgery

clinical_study.official_title: Nasal Intermittent Positive Pressure Ventilation and Mechanical Ventilation With Heliox in Preterm Infants With Respiratory Distress Syndrome

overall_official.affiliation: Dpartment of Pediatrics, Daping Hospital, Third Military Medical University

primary_outcome.description: The primary outcome is the length of ventilation and risk of mechanical ventilation of participants.
primary_outcome.measure: length of ventilation and risk of mechanical ventilation
primary_outcome.time_frame: participants will be followed for the duration of hospital stay, an expected average of 2 weeks

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Director, Head of Pediatrics, Principal Investigator, Clinical Professor

secondary_outcome.measure: Transcutaneous blood gas analysis，ventilator parameters and lung inflammation cytokines
secondary_outcome.time_frame: participants will be followed for the duration of hospital stay, an expected average of 2 weeks

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Factorial Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment
